page.title: 13GOBOWEN VILLAGER REMEMBERS
page.content: {Mrs Watt}has lived in Gobowen village for 70 years. She{remembers}the fox hunt meeting outside a house which is now the post office. There used to be a good quality grocer's,baker, watchmaker and a co-operative store in Brook Buildings. The{village changed when the A5 road was re-routed to a by-pass in the 1950's and now this is having to be replaced. Work on a new by-pass started in June 1985. Mrs Watt remembers (1944) American troups stationed at nearby Halston Hall and as Oswestry was 'out of bounds'they came to local public houses and the dance hall. Her own house was once a butcher's slaughter house. People alighting trains at the station were carried by horse and trap to the Ortopaedic Hospital or Park Hall army camp which is now closed down.
